title: Installation issue: py-astropy
body:
### Short summary

The package `py-astropy` has a few problems:
1. the latest version (1.1.2) in spack is very old (March 2016), current version is 3.2.1
   (see https://pypi.org/project/astropy/)
1. `py-astropy@1.1.2` is uninstallable in both python-2.7.16 (default) and 3.7.3 (latest), see below.

Note that py-astropy *does* install under `python@3.5.0` and I suspect 3.6 as well, as that API change requiring a newer cython (see below) seems to have happened only in python-3.7.

These problems can be fixed by simply adding the latest astropy version (3.2.1) to the package.py, which correctly installs under `python@3.5:3.7.3`.

I could not test with older versions of python given the current requirement of `py-matplotlib@3.5:` (see below) which someone would have to look at separately.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

#### Installing py-astropy@1.1.2 under python@2.7.16 (default)
```console
$ spack install py-astropy@1.1.2 ^python@2.7.16
==> Error: An unsatisfiable version constraint has been detected for spec:
...
while trying to concretize the partial spec:

    py-matplotlib@3.0.2%gcc@6.3.0~animation+image~ipython~latex~qt+tk arch=linux-debian9-x86_64
...
py-matplotlib requires python version 3.5:, but spec asked for 2.7.16
```
and indeed, py-matplotlib is current uninstallable under 2.7.16 as well, with that same error message. It seem py-matplotlib now requires `python@3.5:`

#### Installing py-astropy@1.1.2 under python@3.7.3 (latest)
```console
$ spack install py-astropy@1.1.2 ^python@3.7.3
==> Building py-astropy [PythonPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'build'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/home/repr/cw-software/.spack/opt/spack/linux-debian9-x86_64/gcc-6.3.0/python-3.7.3-pntwkys6pelfpz7zqz4rnrx2carqw42a/bin/python3.7' '-s' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'build' '--use-system-cfitsio' '--use-system-expat'

22 errors found in build log:
     1280    building 'astropy.io.ascii.cparser' extension
     1281    creating build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.7/astropy/io
     1282    creating build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.7/astropy/io/ascii
     1283    creating build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.7/astropy/io/ascii/src
     1284    /home/repr/cw-software/.spack/lib/spack/env/gcc/gcc -Wno-unused-result -Wsign-compare -DNDEBUG -g -fwrapv -O3 -Wall -fPIC -fP
             IC -I/home/repr/cw-software/.spack/opt/spack/linux-debian9-x86_64/gcc-6.3.0/py-numpy-1.16.4-lrdtxpur3x7p75r4zfrwvhcl2ij3czz3/
             lib/python3.7/site-packages/numpy/core/include -I/home/repr/cw-software/.spack/opt/spack/linux-debian9-x86_64/gcc-6.3.0/pytho
             n-3.7.3-pntwkys6pelfpz7zqz4rnrx2carqw42a/include/python3.7m -c astropy/io/ascii/cparser.c -o build/temp.linux-x86_64-3.7/astr
             opy/io/ascii/cparser.o -Wp,-w -Wno-unused-function
     1285    astropy/io/ascii/cparser.c: In function '__Pyx_ExceptionSave':
  >> 1286    astropy/io/ascii/cparser.c:25460:19: error: 'PyThreadState {aka struct _ts}' has no member named 'exc_type'; did you mean 'cu
             rexc_type'?
     1287         *type = tstate->exc_type;
     1288                       ^~
...
```
The reason is simply that the C-code in astropy/io/ascii/cparser.c, which was generated by cython-0.23.4 and shipped as part of the astropy release-tarball, is too old for python 3.7.3, and the names of the internal struct fields in `PyThreadState` have changed.
(see https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/1955)

### Platform and user environment

Please report your OS here:
```commandline
$ uname -a 
Linux StateOfTheArt 4.9.0-9-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.9.168-1+deb9u3 (2019-06-16) x86_64 GNU/Linux

$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Debian GNU/Linux 9.9 (stretch)
```
